intro: Silene montana var. rigidula, commonly known as the rigid mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsules as its fruit type. Silene montana var. rigidula is adapted to cold climates and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
